title: fix(ecma/transform/compat): apply `new.target` before `classes`
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**
A proper fix is impossible, since the only other way to get `new.target` is by `this.constructor`, however in this situation any access to `this` would throw an error. The following code would also generate wrong output
```js
class A {
  constructor() {
    Object.setPrototypeOf(this, null)
    console.log(new.target)
  }
}
```
But consider original issue, apply `new.target` transform later would generate correct result because after class transformation, access `this` in normal function would not throw. If `new.target` is applied first, `this` would be transpiled to `_this` in `classes` which would be `undefined`. The result is **technically incorrect**, but there's no better way. Babel behaves the same, and so does in current swc's `preset-env`
**Related issue (if exists):**
fixes #2682, incompletely

title: feat(swc/cli): plugin scaffolding command
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

PR introduces initial cli features from native swc cli to create plugin project as well as few bikesheddings.

1. swc cli

Introducing a subcommand named `plugin`, provides utilities for the plugin. For now there is only one subcommand.

```
swc plugin new {name} --target-type=wasm32-wasi
```

One of debate was what should be main subcommand for the plugin creation. I considered below two, and choose path to use `plugin` as main subcommand.

```
swc new --type=plugin ...
swc plugin new ...
```

This is slighlty different to future subcommand swc will support, like `compile`, `bundle`, `minify` which is a verb to the action. However, if we choose `new` as main subcommand further plugin-scoped feature will be scattered around each verb-command. Choosing `plugin` as subcommand allows consolidating any other features.

Implementation of scaffolding is very thin and naive. Mostly, it mimics behavior of what `cargo new` does.

- have embedded string based template for the files we'll generate
- directly write files, do not rely on packages like `cargo-generate` or similar template scaffolding
- rely on system's `git` binary instead of trying to embed git / libgit.

This is mostly due to we only need to write 4-5 files at maximum which doesn't require any heavy templating. Decisions to not embed libgit is to avoid heavy dependencies as well as build time. This is not a firm decision, if we're going to expand usage of git / other vcs other than one invocation (`git init`) we may revisit this. 

Lastly, PR includes change to rename `[plugin_module]` macro to `[plguin_transform]`. This'll indicate macro will be used for the transform plugin more clearly.


**BREAKING CHANGE:**
- `plugin_module` is renamed to `plugin_transform`.

**Related issue (if exists):**

https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3311

title: feat(swc/plugin): implement proxy for Mark / SyntaxContext
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Followup for https://github.com/swc-project/swc/pull/3492, attempt to close https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3309.

PR implements rest of Mark / SyntaxContext host fn proxies as same as #3492. It took somewhat longer than I expected to deal with exceptions, which have mutable param with return value. Since we can't call host fn with mutable param, guest fn and host trampoline with serializable context then reassign param from host fn's result.

With this PR, I expect and hope we reached initial feature complete for plugin implementation for the experimental testing phase. Once this PR goes in, will try to make simple scaffolding from swc's cli to create a plugin template for the conviniences.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
-

**Related issue (if exists):**
#3309

title: feat(swc/plugin): implement proxy for Mark::fresh
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Partial implementation for https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3309, before applying same practices, would like to confirm this would bea feasiblee approach.

As similar to previous implementation with plugin_runtime, this PR implements proxy fn for the globals (Mark::fresh in here) which calls host fn when it's being called in plugin's context. Unlike other imported fn signature this doesn't do serialization or copy bytes across memories as Mark is wrapper to u32 value. Fn passes over values directly then each context construct Mark as needed.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**

- DUMMY_SP moved into swc_plugin::syntax_pos namespace.

**Related issue (if exists):**

- #3309

title: feat(swc/plugin): support global HANDLER in plugin context
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Followup changes to https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3308 to support better ergonomics around sharing host context.

This PR follows suggested discussion from https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3309#issuecomment-1020968828. PR creates / exports global `HANDLER` to the plugin side by resembling existing scoped_thread_local's interface (specifically, `HANDLER.with`) with existing emitter in the plugin's side. Primary goal for this change is preserving user ergonomics around `HANDLER`: as test case updated, now either plugin or host would use `HANDLER.with` with provided `swc_common::Handler` for same interfaces. 

One of change to support those was lazy initialization of HANDLER in plugin's context via oncecell. This allows us to create a proper handler per each plugin's context. It requires having stub sync impl, however we know plugin will not require thread safety at all.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
Pretty much unused, but `HostContext` is removed again.

**Related issue (if exists):**
- https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/3308

title: fix(es/minifier): Fix `mapbox`
body:
**Description:**

swc_ecma_minifier:
 - `mangler`: Handle the identifiers of class expressions correctly.





![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29931815/152723382-c031dcc1-f1ec-4437-9cb4-7cdbb8b2721b.png)


As shown above, name mangler assigns `i` to a class expression and uses it again inside the class, as the name of a parameter.
This results in an exception from `new i`.


---

This is a fixed version.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29931815/152724023-f27d11f3-218b-4009-898e-5271cc262170.png)

(I copy-pasted it to js beutifier)


**Related issue (if exists):**

 - https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions/30237?sort=new#discussioncomment-2109335

title: (fix) Class fields are set to undefined if there's no initializer
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**
Fixes #2117 by returning `null` instead of `void 0` for an `initializer` that is not set on property descriptor. [See this comment for good description of problem](https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/2117#issuecomment-1000185405)

This caused tests to fail for #2127 but I have provided alternative fix through checking for `declare` modifier on fields that shouldn't be emitted.

TS ESNext now emits class fields with no initializer by default. See [`useDefineForClassFields`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-7.html#the-usedefineforclassfields-flag-and-the-declare-property-modifier)

```ts
class AClass {
  field: String
}

// emits (pre-esnext)
class AClass {}

// emits (esnext)
class AClass {
  field
}
```

It supports overriding this behaviour through the `declare` modifier.

```ts
class AClass {
  declare field: String
}

// emits (esnext)
class AClass {}
```

https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/960 and https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/2127 should now be solved by using `declare` modifier. Swc will emit class fields by default now to match tsc behaviour.

<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/960
https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/2127

By default, class fields will be defined and set to `undefined` breaking the two issues above.

Fields should have `declare` modifier if they shouldn't be emitted.

```ts
class TestClass2 {
  @deco public declare testProperty: Date;
}
```

**Related issue (if exists):**
https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/2117
https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/2127
https://github.com/swc-project/swc/issues/960

title: Fix lexer
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Bugfix for URL and UrlRawValue:
1. Fix lexer and do not lose whitespaces in token
2. Print valid output for `Url` and `BadUrl` tokens
3. Fix span
4. Improve AST for `UrlValueRaw`, so no whitespaces will be in `value`, it will allow to get real URL without hacks (for example for bundling or linting purposes)
5. Improve minified output, currently we output whitespaces at the end of `UrlRawValue`, but it is unnecessary

**BREAKING CHANGE:**

yes

**Related issue (if exists):**

No

title: Refactor keyframes
body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Refactor `@keyframes name {}` logic:
1. Keyframes at-rules can contain only `KeyframeBlock` and can't contain any `AtRule`
2. Validate ident, because only `from`/`to`/`<percantage>` allowed
3. Rename `KeyframeBlock` fields according spec
4. This PR is required to complete union `SimpleBlock` and `Block` in one Node, so I separate PRs, hope we will finish it on this week
 
**BREAKING CHANGE:**

Yes

**Related issue (if exists):**

No

title: feat(ecma/parser): add allowSuperOutsideMethod option
body:
**Description:**
throw an error when use `super` outside of class and object methods

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
esConfig:
add `allowSuperOutsideMethod`: By default, super use is not allowed outside of class and object methods. Set this to true to accept such code.

for TS, I found that tsc will output the result and throw an error at the same time, so I make this always true
**Related issue (if exists):**
close #3230

2. Namespace output

Improvements:
1. Minify `@media` and `@supports`
2. Avoid spaces in values when it is unnecessary
3. Fix printing in normal mode
4. Many tests to avoid regressions in future
